description.narrative:
Oxfam Uganda has developed a three-phase plan for a briquette production and promotion initiative with refugee and host communitiesin Northern Uganda. This initiative is targeting refugee settlements of Bidi Bidi, Rhino, Imvepi and Palabek and the surrounding areas. The increasing number of refugees in Uganda is adding to the environmental degradation of the areas near the refugee settlements. The additional strain on natural resources (i.e. firewood, arable land, etc.) is becoming a cause of increased tensions betweenhost communities and refugee populations. UN agencies, government officials and community leaders are all looking for ways to address the environmental and social cohesion issues and have consulted with Oxfam to inform the plan of the briquette initiative that seeks to provide an alternative fuel source, while also incorporating EFSVL/WASH outcomes (improved sanitation systems, income generating activities through production/sale of briquettes etc..)
Oxfam Uganda has begun implementation of phase one activities setting up livelihood groups for production, promotion and sale of briquettes made from crop residues. The next phase includes piloting an innovative above-ground latrine model and waste collection system to produce fecal-based briquettes on a larger scale. Oxfam Ugandahas identified and drafted an MOU to partner on phase II with an organisation (Sanivation Ltd) with technical expertise on fecal-based briquettes. However, phase II requires extensive market assessments andproduct testing before moving forward with the pilot implementation in order to determine market size, technical feasibility and capacity for self-sustaining enterprise model in the context of Uganda (Sanivation has had success in other contexts like Kakuma).
With the support from a GHT HSP, Uganda has started the necessary assessments and data collection, but needs an amount of 15,000 USD to fill gap for final research and briquette testing activities to finalize the feasibility study process. This includes biomass assessment and value-chain analysis for fire fuel. These funds and activities will allow Oxfam Uganda and Sanivation to formally enter into an MOU agreement and draft joint Concept Notes/Proposals that will be used to solicit funds from interested funders such as Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation and UNDP. Thus, leveragingthis relatively small amount for research to acquire 1-3 million USD to fund fecal-based briquette pilot projects in partnership with Sanivation.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
